Job description

The Brand Agency, part of Australia's largest communications group WPP AUNZ, is seeking an outstanding Senior Account Manager to join their growing Melbourne team. This is a rare opportunity to become part of a leading agency that's focused on supporting your personal growth and career development.


The role:

You will be working on one of Australia's most iconic retail brands as you manage a wide range of integrated campaigns from conception to completion. With the support of a strong account management team and reporting directly into a SAD, you'll have the room to take ownership of major projects, build solid relationships with key clients and continue to develop your skills across the board.


This role will see you:

  • Become the day-to-day 'go to' for client contacts
  • Work closely with a sizeable strategy team to develop creative briefs and strategic responses
  • Brief in and liaise with the creative team throughout concept development
  • Manage the production process across a range of channels and project manage AV and stills shoots (both in studio and on location)
  • Leverage your meticulous attention to detail and problem-solving abilities to manage timings, budgets and rollout of elements for each campaign
  • Manage your team, whilst supporting their learning and development
  • Work alongside media and search agency partners to bring together campaigns that primarily span TV/OTV, online, press, magazine and third-party content collaborations
  • Receive regular, additional training at the agency (or via external courses) to hone your skills and assist your career growth.


Enjoy the support of the senior management team as you develop and thrive within an environment that's all about passion, work/life balance and recognition for a job well done.


Who we're looking for:

  • This role would be perfect for an excellent communicator that's agile, motivated and looking to work toward becoming a valued AD in the future.
  • You know how to drive a campaign autonomously but you're also a strong team player. You're all about a 'can do' attitude, enjoy sinking your teeth into any new challenge and pride yourself on high quality output. Most of all, you're about getting the detail right, not just getting it done.
  • You will ideally have 4 years’ experience at other integrated agencies. Experience on a retail account is an advantage, but not essential.


If this sounds like you, please email your CV and a brief cover letter to Beth Fletcher: bfletcher@thebrandagency.co


Requirements:

To be considered for this role, you must have the right to live and work in Australia.

We appreciate your understanding that only successful applicants will be contacted, and that due to the high number of applicants we receive, we are unable to reply to individual phone calls or emails.

No recruitment consultants please.

Job description

Lead Consulting Architect
Job no: 570768
Work type: Full time - Continuing/Permanent

  • Full time, Permanent Position
  • $111,645-$119,623 +17% Super
  • Convenient CBD location

Our Organisation

RMIT is a global university of technology, design and enterprise. Our mission is to help shape the world through research, innovation, teaching and engagement, and to create transformative experiences for our students, getting them ready for life and work.

Information Technology Services (ITS) provides RMIT University with Information and Communication Technology systems and services. Our role is to support RMIT’s high quality teaching, learning, research and administrative activities. Information Technology is of increasing importance to the research, teaching and learning life of a university, particularly a ‘global university of technology and design’ like RMIT. ITS has developed, in conjunction with the broader University, an ICT Plan to 2020.

The Role & Your Responsibilities

The Lead Consulting Architect will provide overall architectural guidance and design leadership for initiatives in the University Operations value stream. This role will assist in liaising with CTO Office to understand the strategic roadmap and formulate domain architecture/ initiatives required in line with strategic direction. This also involves creating and leading the architectural design of new technology initiatives to Business Case e.g. cloud foundation, network standardisation. The role will also provide input to existing projects and design on enhancements, collaborating across a broad range of stakeholders to achieve this.

The Lead Consulting Architect is an expert advisor to the Solution Architecture team and coaches and mentors other Architects within the team.

Skills & Experience Required
  • Solid experience as an Lead Consulting Architect/ Lead Solution Architect working on large-scale and technically challenging projects and programs, including infrastructure, network, storage, databases, backup, platforms/operating systems, cloud and virtualisation initiatives;
  • Demonstrated ability to provide thought leadership and technical leadership;
  • Demonstrated ability to build effective relationships in a collaborative and engaging manner with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders;
  • Demonstrated ability to influence and negotiate effectively with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders;
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively under pressure and prioritise activities in complex environments;
  • Demonstrated superior analytical, communication and technical documentation skills.

To Apply

Company Name Defence Science and Technology Group Company Location Fishermans Bend, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 9 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Multiple Research ICT positions at Defence Science & Technology

  • Apply your ICT skills to scientific innovation and research
  • Contribute to world-class research covering the spectrum of defence capability
  • Be a part of one of Australia’s largest employers of scientists and engineers


Position Classification: S&T 3 through to S&T 4 level positions

Salary Range: $66,436 - $91,238 plus 15.4% superannuation

Position Locations: Edinburgh, South Australia, or, Fisherman’s Bend, Victoria

Security Clearance: NV2 up to PV

Enquiries: Mike Kein michael.kein@dst.defence.gov.au (03) 9626 7800


Defence Science and Technology (DST) is the Australian Government’s lead agency responsible for applying science and technology to safeguard Australia. Our vision is to be a world leader in defence science and technology, indispensable in transforming the Australian Defence Force and Australia’s national security.


DST’s Information Management & Technology Branches (IM&T) provide specialised and advanced scientific computing solutions to keep DST at the forefront of Australian Defence innovation. They provide valuable research ICT services to Defence and National Security operations. IM&T are an integrated, multidisciplined, eResearch capability, fostering a culture of excellence, as well as strong client partnerships dedicated to supporting the research needs of DST.


IM&T are seeking six (6) experienced and enthusiastic Research ICT professionals in the areas of:

  • Database Administratoion;
  • Network and Storage Engineers; and
  • Cloud Engineers

\xa0

Experienced candidates looking to enhance their skills and develop a career in advanced scientific computing and specialised research facilities management (inc. scientific data, storage, research networks, virtual computing, researcher collaboration, and data centre operations) are encouraged to apply. You will be required to have: relevant computing qualifications (from certificate to post-graduate degrees); a minimum of 2 years industry experience; and have (or be eligible to gain) relevant industry accreditation. These positions range from those in the early stages of a career at the S&T level 3, through to experienced scientific computing professionals at the S&T level 4.

\xa0

At DST you will have the privilege of working with some of Australia’s most talented and world leading scientists and engineers. Our staff enjoy the benefits of Australian Public Service conditions with competitive salary/non-salary packages including lucrative superannuation, as well as flexible, family-friendly working arrangements. We are committed to helping employees balance work and home life with a range of effective policies, practices and social networks. \xa0 We also provide on-the-job training, access to advanced scientific computing learning opportunities, development prospects to grow your scientific computing skill and experience, as well as mentoring to develop your emerging leadership skills and further expand your capability.


For more information and to apply, please follow this link to the position descriptions on the DST website: DST Group Multiple Research ICT Positions - Position Description DST/01482/18

Senior Project Architect

Company Name Gray Puksand Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 6 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Gray Puksand:
\xa0
Gray Puksand is an Australian architecture and integrated design practice with studios in Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney.

Our vision is to create an inspired future with beautiful, authentic and considered projects that improve the way people work, learn and live.

The human experience is at the heart of everything we create. Working across multiple sectors, from education and commercial architecture to workplace and retail design, our design process begins with investigating and truly understanding our clients’ desires and aspirations. We employ our extensive knowledge, research and excellence in design to create future-proof environments.

Individually, we are accomplished, curious, imaginative designers. Collectively, we are a diverse national team, applying a consistent design methodology to deliver successful projects for our clients and the people who inhabit them.
\xa0
About the Role:
\xa0
We are looking for an experienced Architect with a passion for Education and or Commercial Architecture and Design to join our National Practice with a strong 2020 plan to become a Top 10, Tier 1 Practice.
\xa0
As a Senior Project Architect, you will play a leading hand on role on large Commercial and/or Education projects ranging from 20 to 100+ million dollars.

\xa0

You will become part of a growing team of over 100 Design and Architectural professionals across Australia and join a growing team of nearly 70 highly engaged, passionate and competent professionals in our Melbourne Studio.
\xa0
This is a perfect role for someone who loves their craft and remaining in the architectural designs and drawing whilst expanding their project leading skills.

This role is based at our Head Studio in the heart of the Melbourne CBD. Our offices are at the cutting edge of ‘work-space design’ so you will be surrounded by an inspiring environment every day.

Getting to work is a breeze as we are located within 5 minutes’ walk from Southern Cross Station and Bourke and Collins street trams. In addition, we have secure onsite bike parking and outstanding change facilities with lockers and free towel service! With on-site yoga, a weekly running group and Corporate Triathlon events, you can find the work-life balance you have been looking for. We believe that a balanced life lead to better outcomes for all.


Responsibilities:
\xa0

  • Play an active role in the management and delivery of projects from all stages; concept design to construction
  • Manage the day to day operations of projects, updating Partners when necessary
  • Ability to create and amend drawings in Revit; including checking and marking up drawings and reviewing team members' drawings
  • Building and maintaining client relationships
  • Liaising with clients, consultants and other external stakeholders
  • Working cohesively in a small team, leading where required
  • Contributing to the ongoing development and mentoring of other staff members

\xa0

About you:
\xa0\xa0
We are looking for an experienced Architects with strong Revit skills, who are able to apply their strong design, design development and construction knowledge into something that is inspiring but functional.
\xa0
To be successful in this role you will need:

  • High level of expertise and proficiency in Revit; ideally 5+ years’ experience using Revit
  • Demonstrated experience in developing and delivering designs from briefing to project handover
  • Demonstrated experience in working with Project Managers and Consultants as part of a larger design team
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to proactively communicate with clients, consultants and internal team members
  • Experience and involvement in client relationship management
  • Extensive experience in design development and construction detailing in Commercial or Education sectors will be highly regarded
  • Capacity to work as part of a team with the ability to work autonomously as required
  • Rendering and photoshop skills will be highly regarded

\xa0\xa0\xa0
What is on Offer?

This role presents the opportunity to take a step up in your career and work on complex and interesting projects across a variety of industries including, but not limited to; commercial (green and brown-fields), mixed use, education, retail and retirement lifestyle and care.
\xa0
In addition to this, Gray Puksand can offer:

  • Structured Professional Development
  • Internal Training including Emerging Leaders Program
  • Passionate, highly engaged, respectful, fun-loving team
  • An empowering and encouraging leadership team
  • A growing national firm who will support your career as it goes from strength to strength
  • High calibre projects which will require innovative and ‘out of the box’ thinking


Furthermore, you will be rewarded with a competitive remuneration package and ongoing career development.

\xa0 To Apply:
\xa0
Please press the ‘Apply’ button. Please attach your Folio as the cover letter (ensure these are compressed to 2MB to comply with the file uploads).
\xa0
Find Out More:
\xa0
To find out more about our projects and practice please go to www.graypuksand.com.au

Contact the job poster

Seton Walsh-Rose

Creating an inspired future, through our knowledge and design excellence

The Telstra Health's vision is to be the leading provider of digital health solutions that shape a connected future for healthcare in Australia.

The National Cancer Screening Register (NCSR) is the first major demonstration of Telstra Health's capabilities, as well as a significant Australian Government investment in digital health transformation.

Telstra wants to drive a coordinated and sustainable program of change and adoption to this and future registries. Paving the way for further government investment in national registries by ensure the success of all key stakeholders.

The Relationship and Engagement Team is the business division which manages a large complex matrix of stakeholders across the most senior levels of government, medical practices and key bodies in the state and territory network, as well as key internal stakeholders throughout Telstra Health and the broader Telstra Corporation.

The Project Coordinator will report to the Change and Adoption Lead and support the Relationship and Engagement team to coordinate project and business activities, in order to meet delivery timelines.

  • Maintain a detailed, organised and thorough database of teachers, including unqualified, qualified and active leads
  • Ensure CRM is up-to-date at all times
  • Manage and take responsibility for the entire sales process. Work with teachers to set enrolment deadlines for students, helps develop marketing strategies for the teachers to utilise while enrolling students. \xa0
  • Actively seek to develop and improve skills to build performance. Educate yourself on all related tours and WorldStrides products
  • Research and understand the educational travel industry and develop strategies to win business

\xa0

Additional Responsibilities:


  • Identify regional trends, competitive behaviour, promotional effectiveness, and market intelligence
  • Represent WorldStrides at trade association meetings and other related business events to promote all products and services.
  • Coordinates with department Director with the initiation of new marketing ideas and product development ideas


Requirements

  • A bachelor degree
  • 2-3 years progressive sales experience focusing on customer retention and new business acquisition
  • Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed sales quotas and measurable performance goals
  • Strong communication and presentation skills including the ability to work with all levels of employees and clients in a diplomatic and professional manner
  • The ability to build strong relationships externally and internally
  • The ability to deal with objections
  • Highly self-driven and motivated
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Proficient computer skills and the technical aptitude to master our CRM
  • Ability to multi-task projects and responsibilities and have strong prioritisation skills

\xa0

If this is the sales role you have been looking for, come make your mark on a growing and dynamic company. Qualified candidates should submit their cover letter and CV through LinkedIn.

884620807:
[

Senior Renewable Energy Engineer

Company Name WSP in Australia & New Zealand Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 21 hours ago Number of views 39 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At WSP we develop creative, comprehensive and sustainable engineering solutions for a future where society can thrive. Equipped with an intimate understanding of local intricacies, world-class talent and proactive leadership, we plan, design, manage and engineer long lasting and impactful solutions to uniquely complex problems. With 42,000 talented people in more than 500 offices across 40 countries, we engineer projects that will help societies grow for lifetimes to come

We are dedicated to our local communities and propelled by international brainpower. We are technical experts and strategic advisors including engineers, technicians, scientists, architects, planners, surveyors and environmental specialists, as well as other design, program and construction management professionals.

Here at WSP we design lasting solutions in the Property & Buildings, Transportation & Infrastructure, Environment, Industry, Resources (including Mining and Oil & Gas) and Power & Energy sectors as well as project delivery and strategic consulting services.

At WSP we make extraordinary efforts to attract, develop, engage and retain the best professionals in our fields of expertise because this is what makes us great.

Responsibilities

We are currently seeking to recruit a Senior Renewable Energy Engineer to join our Melbourne Power team to support our wind power Owners/Independent Engineering (OE/IE) capability. The successful candidate will be a self-starter, seeking a challenge to continue to drive and expand our engineering services offering for wind farm development across Australia. The role will be responsible for the provision of technical advisory, due diligence and OE/IE services for multiple clients and exciting projects including but not limited to:
  • Leading and conducting technical due diligence of proposed and existing wind farm assets on behalf of lenders, purchasers or developers/owners.
  • Project management activities, reviewing elements of tech DD, including contracts, financial model, civil, environment and planning, etc.
  • Establishing/consolidating a strong internal network of supporting resources in each discipline and state to support tech DD work.
  • Developing internal processes and procedures around this work.
  • QA and issue of DD reports.
  • Client interface, Q&A with Lenders.
  • Leading and conducting Independent/Lenders Engineer/Certifier roles, such as succinct reporting of progress and issues to project investors and contractor payment claim review and certification and Site inspections.
  • Developing internal processes and procedures around this work.
  • Guiding of junior engineers to support this role.
  • Leading and preparing successful multidisciplinary bids and proposal.
  • Proactively meet with key clients to build trusted adviser relationships.
  • Involved in internal and external Business development activity within the local market and Presenting at conferences (if desired).
  • Growing and maintaining industry contacts amongst developers, suppliers, and investors.
We are a collaborative team of experts that thrives on challenge and unconventional thinking. Channeling our curiosity into creating progressive solutions to complex issues is both our mission and our passion.

Join us in doing purposeful, sustainable work that helps shape our communities and the future!

We are the best professional services firm, positioned to be partners for tomorrow’s challenges.

Express your interest by clicking on the 'apply now' button. Your application will be treated in strict confidence.

WSP supports a diverse and inclusive work environment as well as equal employment opportunities. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people of culturally diverse backgrounds to apply.

  • Civil Engineering
  • Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

Change Analyst - Contract

Company Name Origin Energy Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 97 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • 3 - 6 month contract opportunity
  • Location: Melbourne
  • Role will have a focus on customer meterin
  • Application close date: 1 October 2018


Origin – Australia’s Leading Integrated Energy Company

An integral part of Australia’s energy future, we explore, produce, generate and sell energy to power millions of Australian homes and businesses every day, keeping them going and growing.

Origin is the largest energy retailer in Australia, and with 4.3 million customers we’re constantly evolving and changing to better suit their needs. Our activities include power generation, energy trading, the sale of LPG, electricity, natural gas and solar as well as the development of new and emerging technologies. Consider your possibilities with Australia’s leading integrated energy company.

The Role

The execution of organisational change management (OCM) plans and activities for the Project.

Working closely with the Metering Operations team and other stakeholders in the business to identify process changes, defining new ways of working, and implementing change management activities to impacted teams.

Reporting to the Change Manager, you'll be responsible for the following:
  • Work closely with internal teams to:
    • Ensure change management activities are delivered in line with accepted methodologies
    • Ensuring changes are understood, impacts identified and successfully implemented
  • Supporting training and knowledge management efforts. Provide input, and support the design and delivery of training and operational guides
  • Conducting change impact assessments, and developing associated plans (following BAU processes where possible) to support the implementation of change
  • Ensuring changes to business processes, core system enhancements and new solutions are articulated to end users
  • Developing and delivering communications that support the preparation of the business for the new systems and processes
  • Ongoing updates of project schedule, risks and issues registers for activities related to OCM
  • Development and facilitation of briefing materials to non-customer facing departments
  • Develop and maintain strong & effective relationships with key project and business stakeholders

Is This You?

You'll need to be customer focused, a strong team player, flexible and technically adept.

Certification in change management or business analysis would be advantageous.

You're Experienced In
  • Utilities industry (metering experience would be an advantage)
  • Organisational change management methodology and practice
  • Implementation of Technology based projects
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills potentially with experience in presenting instructional content or information to groups
  • Strong facilitation skills and ability to manage a diverse group of stakeholders
  • Problem solving and implementing improvement opportunities


We embrace the diversity of our people and flexible working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we serve.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

MAKE AN IMPACT ON AUSTRALIA'S ENERGY FUTURE

If dynamic and challenging career opportunities and workplace flexibility are important to you, go with the employer that thinks differently.
